{"step_by_step_thinking": "The splenic artery is a branch of the celiac trunk, which also gives rise to the left gastric artery and the common hepatic artery. The gastroduodenal artery is a branch of the common hepatic artery. The left gastroepiploic artery is a branch of the splenic artery. Therefore, if the splenic artery is ligated at its origin, the left gastroepiploic artery, which is a branch of the splenic artery, will be hypoperfused.", "answer_choice": "C. Left gastroepiploic artery"}
